key_points: Utah football player Aaron Lowe was fatally shot early Sunday in Salt Lake City.
The shooting occurred less than a year after Lowe's teammate and friend Ty Jordan was killed in an accidental shooting.
Utah coach Kyle Whittingham expressed devastation over Lowe's passing and extended thoughts and prayers to his family and friends.
A second person, an unidentified woman, was also shot at the same house party and is in critical condition.
Salt Lake City police received calls about a noise complaint and a fight involving a weapon at the house party.
No arrests have been made in connection to the shooting.
Utah athletic director Mark Harlan praised Lowe as a leader and expressed the university's support for Lowe's family and the athletics community.
Lowe was in his third season at Utah and recently named the first recipient of the Ty Jordan Memorial Scholarship.
Salt Lake City Police Chief Mike Brown and Utah Gov. Spencer Cox both expressed their condolences.
Detectives are working to identify a suspect or suspects involved in the shooting.
spokespersons: Mike Brown (Police Chief, Salt Lake City Police Department)
